1997970495.excerpt:
The overkill backfire effect is a cognitive bias 
that causes people who encounter a complex explanation to reject it in 
favor of a simpler alternative, and to sometimes also reinforce their 
belief in the simpler alternative.

which denotes that the more costly it is to make a signal, and the 
more costly it is to be caught if that signal is dishonest, the more 
reliable that signal appears.
